article.headline: DePaul 70, South Florida 54
article.story: ROSEMONT, Ill. (AP) -- Sammy Mejia scored 26 points to lead DePaul to a 70-54 win over the University of South Florida on Saturday. The Blue Demons (18-12, 9-7 Big East) head into next week's Big East tournament having won five of the last six games. DePaul entered Saturday as the No. 8 seed, with pairings for the 12-team tournament scheduled to be released on Sunday. Mejia was 9-of-13 from the field, including 3-of-4 from 3-point range. Draelon Burns added 11 points. The season sweep of the South Florida (12-19, 3-13) gave DePaul a 13-2 record at Allstate Arena this year, the Blue Demons' best home campaign in 15 years. South Florida, which did not qualify for the conference tournament, ended its season on a seven-game losing streak. Kentrell Gransberry scored 26 points and matched an arena record with 23 rebounds, getting 13 on the offensive glass for the Bulls. DePaul had a 49-31 lead early in the second half, but went nearly five minutes without a field goal. The Bulls pulled to 62-52 with 2:47 to play, but DePaul closed out the game with an 8-0 run. South Florida trailed 36-25 at intermission, kept close by Gransberry, who scored seven of his nine first-half points in the final 4:18 of the period.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
